tweets.text: CEVs Paul and Peter with the 10:30am report. River level 28mAOD with the river level steady currently and just breaching the bullpit. Stear clear of flood water. @DWFRSBoA @BoATownCouncil @Trow_Fire_Stn @EnvAgencySW @WiltshireWinter https://t.co/5StC4kjMMW
Great to hear @ThamesPathNT report that river levels are falling upstream. https://t.co/LFobqEYrUu

domain.name: Interests and Hobbies Category
domain.description: A grouping of interests and hobbies entities, like Novelty Food or Destinations

tweets.text:
Do you know what to do if you receive a #flood warning?

Find out what they mean and how to act if you receive one here: https://t.co/jy09V7dl96  

#Flooding #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/AwJZOz70Pg

@richardkendall @EnvAgencyAnglia Think it's just the flood plain doing its job from very heavy waterfall and then how the system works - water has to go somewhere. It's rare for it to be this bad, so while we usually use all this land normally, it's designed to work in this way to limit the effect elsewhere.

If you’re planning a big end of year clear out, be careful who you hire to dispose of your waste. Waste criminals pose as genuine waste collectors, take people's money but dump the waste illegally, putting our environment at risk.  

Share this video to let others know. https://t.co/NybBUaD4X8

We have issued two severe #flood warnings at Cogenhoe Mill Caravan Site and Billing Aquadrome due to flood risk in the #Northampton area.
 
We're working closely with the emergency services who are now evacuating these sites. Stay safe and don’t walk or drive through floodwater.

When rivers are flooded, the current can be strong enough to sweep you away.

We're expecting further river #flooding across central and east England.
 
Check your #flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L https://t.co/QRCVJJglYb

My thanks to @bill_handley55 who kindly volunteered to door knock.  Tough time to be at risk of flooding but be assured that @EnvAgencyAnglia @CambsCC @CambsCops @cambsfrs @SouthCambs are all working closely to minimise impact and support residents where they need help

Back on Flood Operations Duty Throughout today, barriers at #Hereford #Shrewsbury #Ironbridge #Bewdley still deployed, gates at #Upton #Uckinghall #Deerhurst #Ashleworth still closed and our teams out checking and operating assets @EnvAgencyMids oh and not forgetting the Snow 😳 https://t.co/WfTLnuLhep

tweets.text: The extent of the Gt Ouse floodplain is so impressive.. the defences built in St Ives since Easter 1998 floods are all set to be tested @EnvAgencyAnglia https://t.co/veZtew6IqQ
We are planning on doing gate movement 2 on the #Jubilee River at 9am this morning .@EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @johncurtinEA @SteveMooreEA @wifo_ea

9.40am, Monday

We still many flood warnings and alerts in place...

Please check your area...

Get the latest here: https://t.co/3BhMIvEYbG

Plus great advice... like moving valuables upstairs, and putting medicines in a bag...
#floodaware https://t.co/PXlIJe8zVh
Earith is some 40km inland at the fluvial and tidal interface within the Great Ouse catchment. It is a key pressure point in the system @EnvAgencyAnglia #ousewashes https://t.co/uVJ03CxTtc

tweets.text: We have reports of people in flood waters. Please do not walk, swim or drive through flood water. The rivers are flowing very quickly & you can’t tell where the edge of the path meet the river. There's many hidden dangers inc raised manhole covers & 30cm of water can move a car.

tweets.text: #South Hinksey temporary defence Barriers ,so much easier to deploy correctly in daylight ,all barriers checked and keeping residents dry ,well done to the field teams . ⁦@EnvAgencySE⁩ ⁦@MarkHill03⁩ ⁦@johncurtinEA⁩ ⁦@wifo_ea⁩ https://t.co/oPJeTEmauD

@MariaHerlihyEA @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @johncurtinEA @SteveMooreEA @wifo_ea How is it that since you have stopped working down at black Potts you have released a heck of a lot of water and now in datchet the river is extremely high compared to two weeks ago when you closed off. Now we face flooding because of your actions at the EA

Day28 of my #30DayRunningChallenge

it is a late #WhiteChristmas for many places, and there is heavy mist here in #StAlbans

Curious to know if @radioverulam had any coverage of the flooding in the park. It is heavier today, and the passive way of stopping people isn't working.
@EvansKerry @DrAlexFord @EnvAgency @Ofwat Thanks, but those monies would still be better spent on environmental improvement.

Outdated flood sirens in Grimsby and Cleethorpes will not be used from 31 December.

Instead, the Flood Warning Service reaches more people with better information and is the best way to stay alert. Sign up https://t.co/SAcXCYjoCa

Read more https://t.co/apYdmzTrnS #Lincolnshire https://t.co/CcH3XpAd7N

Following heavy rainfall yesterday and overnight, we have operated the Foss Barrier to help protect properties in York. In this video, our asset performance advisor Mark Fuller explains how it works #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/mMPzvj913L

@Bidlet47 @DrAlexFord @EnvAgency The money that went back to customers was from @Ofwat penalties- Environment Agency investigations are awaiting the next date in court
A little more background here... https://t.co/0VBDWMNFCy

urls.title: Environment Agency's use of civil sanctions
urls.description: Cases for which the Environment Agency has accepted an enforcement undertaking (EU) or imposed a civil sanction for environmental offences.

tweets.text:
@Bidlet47 @DrAlexFord @EnvAgency What you are describing is an Enforcement Undertaking- which can be an option in certain circumstances
https://t.co/TBdbel3Jt0
@EnvAgencyYNE @handymelon 😳.  Hope you ok

It's not just champion boxer #AnthonyJoshua or Uncle Jim's #Christmas home brew that will knock you sideways...

#FLOODWATER can, too... 

📽️ MORE in our short video...
#floodaware #StormBella https://t.co/5GM312d8Be

tweets.text: @EvansKerry @DrAlexFord @EnvAgency Fine, but the money should be used to improve water quality and to deal with the recent discharge which the Prof tweeted about, not go back to customers. What use is that!?

We have issued a flood warning for: Isolated low lying properties along the tidal River Waveney

Please keep up-to-date with the latest situation in your area. 

Our flood warnings are updated every 15 minutes here: https://t.co/MztuI4Ooz5 

#SafetyFirst #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/lPtgOruECI

Many areas are on alert for a cold snap, following #StormBella over the weekend ⬇️

@johncurtinEA @EnvAgency Great stuff. One question though - how do you know how many properties flooded? Is that simply intersection of flood warning areas and rooftop lat longgs or actual reports of flooded properties?
